24907373.trustfund: BBMPT-BB MONTREAL PROTOCOL,TF016930-Thailand ODS Phaseout Project,TF021926-OTF - THAILAND ODS PHASE OUT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Thailand - Montreal Protocol Ozone
            Depleting Substances Phase-Out Multi-Component Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall outcome rating of Montreal
            Protocol ozone depleting substances phase-out
            multi-component Project for Thailand was judged to be
            satisfactory.  The Bank and borrower performance were
            satisfactory. The risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible. Significant changes included extension of
            closing dates and a change in the project implementation
            modality of Halon Management Programme, Halon Recovery,
            Recycling and Banking Sub-project.  Several lessons were
            learned. Commitment from the government and related
            stakeholders to the phase-out obligations was critical to
            ensure compliance with all obligations in a smooth and
            sustainable manner. A project management unit (PMU) was
            established to be responsible for the operation of the
            multi-year project. Due to a number of activities to be
            carried out under the multi-year project, PMU should be
            staffed with competent and skilled personnel to ensure
            effective implementation and delivery of the multi-year
            project in the future. The disbanding of the Department of
            Industrial Works (DIW) led to severe disruptions because the
            National Ozone Unit (NOU) did not have the capacity and
            experience to implement the remaining tasks. In hindsight,
            the Bank could have required the DIW to have an adequate
            transitional plan in place before disbanding the PMU and
            transferring its functions to the understaffed NOU.
            Implementation in the service sectors was more complicated
            than in the manufacturing sector. To deal more successfully
            with small enterprises, incentives should be provided to
            these workshops to urge them to participate in the program.
            The Bank should have updated the Results Framework
            continuously in the implementation and status reports for
            both Bank management and client. This operation lasted
            almost 19 years from start to finish, but it demonstrates
            that older projects can be successful by rolling through
            different aspects of Ozone Depleting Substance (ODS)
            phase-out sequentially. Not having to prepare a new PAD each
            time a new ODS was introduced for phase-out meant that the
            team was not distracted by administrative tasks.

14460326.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
14460326.trustfund: TF021926-OTF - THAILAND ODS PHASE OUT PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Thailand - Methyl Bromide Phase-out Project
            : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Methyl Bromide
            Phase-out Project for Thailand is to assist the Government
            of Thailand (GOT) to completely phase out its Methyl Bromide
            (MB) consumption in non quarantine and non-preshipment
            applications in accordance with the phase-out schedule
            mandated by the Montreal Protocol. The most important impact
            of current practices is ozone layer depletion caused by MB.
            For phosphine, no evidence of impact, except the trouble
            when collecting phosphine tablets that are not completely
            decomposed since it is easy to generate flames and
            potentially explosions. Moreover, phosphine may corrode
            copper and electronic equipments and cause pest resistance.
            High efficacy to control pests for durable commodities. Need
            longer exposure period and may cause resistance of insects
            if not properly done. Both MB and chemicals used for
            structure treatment may cause negative impact to
            environment. Mitigation measures include: 1) development of
            pest control standards for storage facilities; 2)
            development and implementation of accreditation program for
            storage facilities; 3) local and oversea training of
            Department of Agriculture (DOA) officers that are not the
            trainers of authorized training centers; 4) development of
            training modules; 5) modification of fumigation enclosure;
            and 6) training of MB users and training updates.

display_title.display_title:
Thailand - Methyl Bromide
            Phase-out Project : environmental assessment : Pest
            management plan
